l:dependency.name: Build Monitor View
l:dependency.l:description: Provides a highly visible view of the status of selected Jenkins jobs. It easily accommodates different computer screen sizes and is ideal as an Extreme Feedback Device to be displayed on a screen on your office wall.

l:dependency.name: Protocol Buffer Java API
l:dependency.l:description: Protocol Buffers are a way of encoding structured data in an efficient yet extensible format.

l:dependency.name: Data Mapper for Jackson
l:dependency.l:description: Data Mapper package is a high-performance data binding package built on Jackson JSON processor

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons BeanUtils
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Commons BeanUtils provides an easy-to-use but flexible wrapper around reflection and introspection.

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: JSR310
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module to support JSR-310 (Java 8 Date & Time API) data types.

l:dependency.name: jackson-databind
l:dependency.l:description: General data-binding functionality for Jackson: works on core streaming API

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons IO
l:dependency.l:description: The Apache Commons IO library contains utility classes, stream implementations, file filters, file comparators, endian transformation classes, and much more.

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: jdk8
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support JDK 8 data types.

l:dependency.name: JavaBeans Activation Framework API jar
l:dependency.l:description: JavaBeans Activation Framework API jar

l:dependency.name: Jackson-annotations
l:dependency.l:description: Core annotations used for value types, used by Jackson data binding package.

l:dependency.name: Jackson-dataformat-XML
l:dependency.l:description: Data format extension for Jackson to offer alternative support for serializing POJOs as XML and deserializing XML as pojos.

l:dependency.name: Woodstox
l:dependency.l:description: Woodstox is a high-performance XML processor that implements Stax (JSR-173), SAX2 and Stax2 APIs

l:dependency.name: FindBugs-jsr305
l:dependency.l:description: JSR305 Annotations for Findbugs

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.

l:dependency.name: Jackson
l:dependency.l:description: Jackson is a high-performance JSON processor (parser, generator)

l:dependency.name: Jackson-dataformat-YAML
l:dependency.l:description: Support for reading and writing YAML-encoded data via Jackson abstractions.

l:dependency.name: Jackson module: JAXB Annotations
l:dependency.l:description: Support for using JAXB annotations as an alternative to "native" Jackson annotations, for configuring data-binding.

l:dependency.name: SnakeYAML
l:dependency.l:description: YAML 1.1 parser and emitter for Java

l:dependency.name: Stax2 API
l:dependency.l:description: tax2 API is an extension to basic Stax 1.0 API that adds significant new functionality, such as full-featured bi-direction validation interface and high-performance Typed Access API.

l:dependency.name: jakarta.xml.bind-api
l:dependency.l:description: JAXB (JSR 222) API

l:dependency.name: EdDSA-Java
l:dependency.l:description: Implementation of EdDSA in Java

l:dependency.name: Jackson datatype: org.json
l:dependency.l:description: Support for datatypes of "org.json" JSON library (see http://json.org/java), mainly to make it easier to upgrade code to Jackson, using automated conversions.

l:dependency.name: less4j
l:dependency.l:description:
Less language is an extension of css and less4j compiles it into regular css. It adds several dynamic features into css: variables, expressions, nested rules.
Less4j is a port. The original compiler was written in JavaScript and is called less.js. The less language is mostly defined in less.js documentation/issues and by what less.js actually do. Links to less.js: * home page: http://lesscss.org/ * source code & issues: https://github.com/cloudhead/less.js

l:dependency.name: Jackson-module-parameter-names
l:dependency.l:description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support introspection of method/constructor parameter names, without having to add explicit property name annotation.

l:dependency.name: Snakeyaml API Plugin
l:dependency.l:description: This plugin packages stock Snakeyaml library

l:dependency.name: Jackson-core
l:dependency.l:description: Core Jackson processing abstractions (aka Streaming API), implementation for JSON

l:dependency.name: Jackson 2 API Plugin
l:dependency.l:description: This plugin exposes the Jackson 2 JSON APIs to other Jenkins plugins.

l:dependency.name: Antlr 3.4 Runtime
l:dependency.l:description: A framework for constructing recognizers, compilers, and translators from grammatical descriptions containing Java, C#, C++, or Python actions.
